Designathon.description:
Get ready to unleash your creativity and innovation at our upcoming Designathon! 🎨💡 
This is not just a competition, it's an opportunity to enrich your portfolio and network with the best in the design community.🚀🌐 👥 Teams of 1-3 are welcome. Open to all students passionate about design. 🎓💼📝 Engage in real-world case study projects that will not only challenge you but also add value to your professional portfolio. 🌟📚
rules: Team size should be 1-3.
Inter year teams are allowed

Gamestation.description:
Brace yourselves for Nitkkr's gaming extravaganza – GameStation 2024!👨🏻‍💻 Embark on a virtual adventure 🤩 starting from March 14th, where the pixels come alive and competition ignites 🤖. It's not just an esports event; it's a celebration of skills, strategy, and sheer gaming passion. Whether you're a seasoned player or a casual gamer, this is your arena 🎯. Join us for a gaming odyssey that transcends screens and sparks excitement 💻. Unleash your competitive spirit, forge new alliances, and claim victory 🏆 in the biggest esports event on the horizon 👑.

📅 Dates: 14th to 17th March
📍Venue: ED Hall

Save the date, power up your consoles 🎮 , and let the games begin
rules: Standard rules of programming contest will be enforced.

Webhunt.description:
Everyone thinks of being a pirate 🥷🏻at some point in their life, so, we at TechSpardha’22 are back with WebHunt 🔎 to bring out the Jack Sparrow 🏴‍☠️ inside of you and find the Isle of Lusee 🏝 

You'll be provided with some fun 👾and challenging riddles 🪄 from various fields, be it your favorite tv shows 📺, the games🎮 you play every day or just anything you can ever imagine of.

With Google  (who uses Bing? btw) at your disposal, search 🔍 anything you want to get to the answer
rules: Team size should be 2.
Inter year teams are allowed
Use of google is mandatory.

Black Box.description: Hola Sherlock's 🧐🧐\nBring into play the principle of reversibility🔄 in your heads and pen down your arithmetic skills📝 to find the raw data as we are back with brainstorming🤯 event of the era , Black Box📦 at Techspardha 2K23!\nPut your quizzing caps🤠 on and get ready to sweat to compete with amazing.
rules: Standard rules of programming contest will be enforced.
Dou Event.

Encoder.description:
Impress FAANG by showcasing your coding skills in "Encoder," as these tech giants often recruit from platforms like Code studio! 🌟🚀🧠

🕰️Set your alarms and clear your schedule! On March 14th, 2024, at 9:00 P.M.,Technobyte will host a 2-hour coding marathon on code studio where you can test your skills against some of the brightest minds in the coding community. 🕰️

🧠 Crack six brain-bending problems in 2 hours and prizes worth ₹4,000 & premium coding ninja merchandise. 🔥
🧠👾This is your chance to embark on an exciting coding adventure, hone your skills, and connect with like-minded individuals who share your passion for technology. 🖥️💻
So, what are you waiting for? 🌟
Let's dive into the world of coding and see where your talents can take you! 🚀🧠👾

*Gform link*: https://forms.gle/6fzGjnaq9vzYxHhJ8
*Link for registration*: http://tinyurl.com/CENITK14MARCH

*It is mandatory to fill both form and register through above link for a valid participation*
_Registration should be done using above links only_
rules: Standard rules of programming contest will be enforced.
Single Member Event.

Excalibur.description:
"The purpose of technology is not to confuse the brain, but to serve the body"

Do you consider yourself as the most competitive person in a room? Do challenges excite you? Are you interested in tickling your brain and fueling your grey matter to create an impact?

EXCALIBUR, the flagship event of Technobyte gives you the opportunity to do all of this, along with winning exciting prizes for your innovative solutions.
If you want to showcase your analytical, technical and problem solving skills and get exposure to industry-leading ventures, create a team, participate and elevate your creativity.
rules: Use of Git is mandatory.
After completion, the event itself would have a presentation and a working demo of the project.
After proper evaluation, if the idea is selected, you’ll be assigned a mentor to complete the project before the final event.
First round: Abstract submission, abstract must include, the team members, the title of the project, the idea elaborated, tech stack to be used.
Team size should be 1-4. Inter-year teams are allowed.
Three rounds

Hackshetra.description:
📢 Calling all developers! Get ready to transform your coffee☕ into code on the most thrilling tech battlefield – Hackshetra🤖, brought to you by Techspardha’24 at NIT Kurukshetra. Grab your laptops💻 and brace yourselves for 24 hours of non-stop coding excitement! Show off your development skills and compete for prizes🏆 worth 6K.

At Hackshetra, you'll face challenges based on themes💡 revealed on the spot. Choose your problem statements 🎯 and leverage cutting-edge software technologies to craft innovative solutions.

No prior experience is necessary – all you need is the passion to learn. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned coder, this event is your chance to shine and unleash your creativity🧩. Get ready to dive into the action-packed tech battlefield!

Mark your calendars🗓️ for 9th–10th March, 2024. The event kicks off at 11 am sharp on 9th March in the 📍CCN block.
rules: The only eligibility criteria to take part is to have will to learn🤓 and your creativity is the limit. Get ready to have one of the biggest learning experiences in just 24 hours!!! 🥳🔥
Team up (2-4 members)
Initial elimination based on proposed solutions and designs.
Second elimination evaluates progress made during the event.
The only eligibility criteria to take part is to have will to learn🤓 and your creativity is the limit. Get ready to have one of the biggest learning experiences in just 24 hours!!! 🥳🔥
Team up (3-5 members)
Initial elimination based on proposed solutions and designs.
Second elimination evaluates progress made during the event.

WebCraft.description: These classes are being organized once in aweek and were started on 26th August, 2023. It's main purpose is to promote coding culture in our college. Empower participants with hands-on skills in web development, covering design, codingand tools for creating impactful digital experiences. The target audience is first year and second year. The mentors are from B.Tech. Pre-Final and Final year students and around 250 students attend these classes.

CP/DSA Classes.description: These classes are being organized once in a week and were started on 28th August, 2023. It's main purpose is to promote coding culture in our college. The topics that are covered in these classes include Competitive Programming (CP) and Data Structures &Algorithms (DSA). The target audience is second year and pre final year. The mentors are from B.Tech. Pre-Final and Final year students and around 100 students attend these classes.

CodeRun.description: It is a series of coding contests based on competitive programming and DSA which is conducted biweekly. This contest series started on 13th November, 2022 and is still continuing. It was intended to promote coding culture in the institute. The problem setters are from Btech pre-final and final year and around 60-80 students participate in these contests.
rules: Standard rules of programming contest will be enforced.
Single Member Event.
